methods.name: render
methods.description:
Call this method after updating menu bar `items` dynamically, including changing
any property on the item object corresponding to one of the menu bar buttons.

properties.name: openOnHover
properties.description: If true, the submenu will open on hover (mouseover) instead of click.

attributes.name: open-on-hover
attributes.description: If true, the submenu will open on hover (mouseover) instead of click.

properties.name: autofocus
properties.description: Specify that this control should have input focus when the page loads.

properties.name: _previousTabIndex
properties.description: Stores the previous value of tabindex attribute of the disabled element

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

methods.name: focus
methods.description: Moving the focus from the host element causes firing of the blur event what leads to problems in IE.

methods.name: blur
methods.description:
Native bluring in the host element does nothing because it does not have the focus.
In chrome it works, but not in FF.

methods.name: _addEventListenerToNode
methods.description: Add the event listener to the node if it is a gestures event.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to add event listener to

methods.name: _removeEventListenerFromNode
methods.description: Remove the event listener to the node if it is a gestures event.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to remove event listener from

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Specify that this control should have input focus when the page loads.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

properties.name: theme
properties.description:
Helper property with theme attribute value facilitating propagation
in shadow DOM. Allows using `theme$="[[theme]]"` in the template.

properties.name: items
selector
properties.description:
CSS selector that can be used to target any child element
of the context menu to listen for `openOn` events.

properties.name: opened
properties.description: True if the overlay is currently displayed.

properties.name: openOn
properties.description: Event name to listen for opening the context menu.

properties.name: listenOn
properties.description:
The target element that's listened to for context menu opening events.
By default the vaadin-context-menu listens to the target's `vaadin-contextmenu`
events.

properties.name: closeOn
properties.description: Event name to listen for closing the context menu.

properties.name: renderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of the menu overlay.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The root container DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `contextMenu` The reference to the `<vaadin-context-menu>` element.
- `context` The object with the menu context, contains:
  - `context.target`  the target of the menu opening event,
  - `context.detail` the menu opening event detail.

methods.name: _addEventListenerToNode
methods.description: Add the event listener to the node if it is a gestures event.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to add event listener to

methods.name: _removeEventListenerFromNode
methods.description: Remove the event listener to the node if it is a gestures event.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to remove event listener from

methods.name: _onOverlayOpened
methods.description: Runs before overlay is fully rendered

methods.name: _onVaadinOverlayOpen
methods.description: Runs after overlay is fully rendered

methods.name: _openedChanged
methods.description: Overriding the observer to not add global "contextmenu" listener.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Overriding the public method to reset expanded button state.

params.name: e
params.description: used as the context for the menu. Overlay coordinates are taken from this event.

selector

CSS selector that can be used to target any child element
of the context menu to listen for `openOn` events.

attributes.name: listen-on
attributes.description:
The target element that's listened to for context menu opening events.

attributes.description: Event name to listen for closing the context menu.

attributes.name: renderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of the menu overlay.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The root container DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `contextMenu` The reference to the `<vaadin-context-menu>` element.
- `context` The object with the menu context, contains:
  - `context.target`  the target of the menu opening event,
  - `context.detail` the menu opening event detail.

events.name: item-selected
events.description: Fired when an item is selected when the context menu is populated using the `items` API.

elements.description:
`<vaadin-menu-bar>` is a Web Component providing a set of horizontally stacked buttons offering
the user quick access to a consistent set of commands. Each button can toggle a submenu with
support for additional levels of nested menus.

To create the menu bar, first add the component to the page:

```
<vaadin-menu-bar></vaadin-menu-bar>
```

And then use [`items`](#/elements/vaadin-menu-bar#property-items) property to initialize the structure:

```
document.querySelector('vaadin-menu-bar').items = [{text: 'File'}, {text: 'Edit'}];
```

### Styling

The following shadow DOM parts are exposed for styling:

Part name         | Description
------------------|----------------
`container`       | The container wrapping menu bar buttons.
`menu-bar-button` | The menu bar button.
`overflow-button` | The "overflow" button appearing when menu bar width is not enough to fit all the buttons.

See [ThemableMixin – how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)
